item.title: GIF screencasts (Ubuntu)
item.description: To record short screencasts on Ubuntu I use byzanz. Byzanz is a desktop recorder and command line tool allowing you to record your current desktop or parts of it to an animated GIF, Ogg Theora, Flash or WebM. To install: sudo apt-get install byzanz To use: (with 5 second delay) byzanz-record --delay=5 --duration=10 --x=878 --width=722 --height=434 ~/Desktop/vim.gif or an alternative syntax: (using both X and Y) byzanz-record -d 10 -x 878 -y 200 -w 722 -h 434 ~/Desktop/vim.
